AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Edward M. Kennedy: United States Senator who described the sentencing guidelines as a comprehensive approach to reduce disparity in punishment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Sentencing Commission Guid: Guidelines for federal sentencing, applied by courts to determine sentence ranges based on the crime committed, not the offender, aiming to reduce unacceptable disparity of punishment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Congress: Federal legislative body that enacted the sentencing guidelines to ensure fair and uniform sentences
